title: Publish Energy Dataset
description: Note: Before publishing any dataset, you should be familiar with all of the following: EW-DOS, EW-Messaging, EW-Switchboard, and how EWAI works in general, so you can make sure roles are properly setup and to provision the DER devices properly to send data. In order to publish an energy dataset, a number of setup steps must have been take prior in EW Switchboard.
warning: This is an ALPHA conceptual prototype site! Please familiarize yourself with [Energy Web EWAI](https://energyweb.org), [Ocean Protocol Marketplaces](https://oceanprotocol.com/technology/marketplaces), [the risks](https://blog.oceanprotocol.com/on-staking-on-data-in-ocean-market-3d8e09eb0a13), and the [Terms of Use](#).

data.name: name
data.label: Title
data.placeholder: e.g.: South Coast Wind Turbin Farm Power Data

data.name: ewaiEwns
data.label: EWNS
data.help: Enter the unique EWNS (EnergyWeb Name Service) identifier that will identify this energy data asset

data.name: description
data.label: Description
data.help: Add a thorough description with as much detail as possible. You can use [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/basics).

data.name: ewaiCategory
data.label: Category
data.help: Specify the energy category for the data asset.

data.name: ewaiVendor
data.label: Vendor/Manufacturer
data.help: Enter the vendor/manufacturer of the DERs sending data into this dataset (if desired)

data.name: ewaiPublishRole
data.label: Publish Role Required
data.help: Enter the EW Switchboard role that DERs must have in order to be able to send data into this dataset. You must have set this up in EW Switchboard

data.name: ewaiIncomingMsgFormat
data.label: Incoming Message Format
data.help: Specify the format for PTD data messages which DERs will be sending into this data asset.

data.name: ewaiSchemaValidationOn
data.label: EWAI Schema Validation Enabled
data.help: Specify whether to perform schema validation on the PTD data messages being sent into this dataset. This only applies when using Json incoming message format. Message schema validation will be performed when this flag is true and a Json Schema has been entered in the next field below. All other times, no schema validation on incoming messages will occur.

data.name: ewaiMsgSchema
data.label: EWAI Message Schema
data.help: Enter the JSON Schema validation to be used to ensure all messages sent to this data asset meet a specified data shape. See [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/json-schema-validation.html). Note: Schema validation is only supported for incoming Json Message types at this time.

data.name: ewaiPathToPtdTimestamp
data.label: Specify where the timestamp is in the incoming PTD messages
data.placeholder: e.g.: ts or sensor.data.timestamp or time=(.*?);
data.help: For Json message types, enter the fully qualified Json Path to the timestamp field in the message. For Text message types, enter a RegEx that will extract the timestamp from the message.

data.name: access
data.label: Access Type
data.help: Choose how you want your files to be accessible for the specified price.

data.name: ewaiOutputFormat
data.label: EWAI Output Data Format
data.help: Specify the output data format for this dataset.

data.name: dataTokenOptions
data.label: Datatoken Name & Symbol
data.help: The datatoken for this data set will be created with this name & symbol.

data.name: author
data.label: Author
data.help: Give proper attribution for your data set.

data.name: termsAndConditions
data.label: Terms & Conditions
options: I agree to these Terms and Conditions
